
{{alias}}( n )
    Computes the nth Bernoulli number.

    If not provided a non-negative integer value, the function returns `NaN`.

    If provided `NaN`, the function returns `NaN`.

    Parameters
    ----------
    n: integer
        Input value.

    Returns
    -------
    y: number
        Bernoulli number.

    Examples
    --------
    > var y = {{alias}}( 0 )
    1.0
    > y = {{alias}}( 1 )
    0.0
    > y = {{alias}}( 2 )
    ~0.166
    > y = {{alias}}( 3 )
    0.0
    > y = {{alias}}( 4 )
    ~-0.033
    > y = {{alias}}( 5 )
    0.0
    > y = {{alias}}( 20 )
    ~-529.124
    > y = {{alias}}( 260 )
    -infinity
    > y = {{alias}}( 262 )
    infinity
    > y = {{alias}}( NaN )
    NaN

    See Also
    --------
